description:
Small but well crafted menu. Sometimes simplicity is the best you can find. Great wine list, great small bites selection,  and perfect service.

Definitely coming back
author: Yuri C.

description: So happy to have found this little gem...a friend was visiting from out of town and we decided to give this place a try. I will definitely be back! Friendly staff, excellent wine and very cozy atmosphere. It is very small inside but that's part of the charm. Great low key date night spot or just a chill spot to enjoy a glass of wine with a friend.
author: Meghan L.

description: Cozy place to sit back and relax with a great glass of wine (or two).  I always get the flight and test 3 diffent wines.  Without fail, we get a bottle of one of them for home.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
I love the fact that Stephanie and Keith are promoting small wine producers in California.  As I travel through my 23 fabulous wine districts (as a member of the State Board of Equalization), I really appreciate the variety of the wines we produce in California and appreciate especially our small specialty wine producers. California is the #3 wine producing region in the world. 

This is a rare occasion however when I patronize a restaurant in California and they don't sell ONE California wine I always ask "REALLY?"  There is no excuse...because California produces so many delicious varieties.  Thank you Stephanie and Keith for 10 years in business!
author: Fiona M.

description: Suuuuuper cozy comfy low key nice but not too pretentious place for "nifty 40-somethings". That last bit was what the "Yelp insight" told me. Oddly and creepily correct.
author: Eden W.

description: Great neighborhood wine bar. Not The Press Club with its voluminous list and voluminous everything. Just a comfortable, friendly place to have some wine and light food items. The owners are great and the wine is fairly priced. Small but with lots of seating arrangements from cozy couches to a bar to small tables. I had a flight of cabs that were interesting. After fighting traffic downtown and looking (and not finding) parking, I'm glad we decided to just drive out of the mayhem, across Castro and out to West Portal which is a gem of a neighborhood.
author: Brian B.

description: Happen to be in the area, and checking out what to do... Pretty good selection of wines, and very friendly owners... It was a warm Sunday afternoon, so the place wasn't busy.. WIll definitely be back
author: John Z.

description: Found on yelp when staying in the Sunset. Walked here n so glad we found it! Had the flight, empanadas, cheese pairing with the flight, another glass with cheese. Wonderful experience. Stayed until closing at 11.
author: Ron N.

description: We've come here about a dozen times after seeing a movie at nearby West Portal Theater. The ambience is perfect for a low-key but fun and romantic drink from a great, idiosyncratic and affordable wine list. The flight of three reds is our go to drink, usually accompanied by the delicious cheese plate, sometimes the charcuterie plate, and if we missed dinner, maybe an empanada. The service is always top notch, friendly and fun. Highly recommended!
author: Matthew S.

description:
Oh, what a great little wine bar! He came here with your girlfriend just to grab a drink, and it was so nice! There were two people working the bar on Friday night the place was pretty felt! The place is self is very small, but it was just enough to fit everyone. I'd say they have a good selection of wines, but I'm just starting to get into rain so I can't comment too much on it. However the bartenders did a great job of explaining different wines, and helping me pick out a really good one.

The bartenders are also really great and wonderful people to even strike up conversations with.

They also have cheese plates which are so yummy, but a little pricey. Actually the whole place is just slightly over the price that I would like to pay, but not super super expensive.

Overall, a great place and I'll probably be back... Just watch out because it's super dark in there, and if you have bad eyesight like me, you have a hard time seeing the person you're talking to you.
author: Elysia M.

description: Love that the wine list changes - it's fun to try different wines from different regions! The owner is incredibly knowledgeable and friendly and sweet. We love to go and have a glass of whatever is the special with cheese.
author: Margaret M.

description:
Now that the gang and I are 26, we try to tone down with throwing back shots and try to visit wine bars instead. For us girls, we usually opt to have a fancy affair to celebrate our birthdays but for Mr. Dubs, he preferred somewhere classy but cozy. 

Sorry JT, no suit&tie required.

Que Syrah is the definition of a cozy neighborhood wine bar. The owner (or servers) were extremely nice and helpful. In fact, not only did they allow us to bring a cake (a very x-rated and inappropriate cake) with no cake cutting fees but they were completely ok with us going over to Bull's Head and bring back some juicy burgers to indulge inside. 

Overall, it was just a very pleasant experience from start to end. I was impressed that this teeny tiny wine bar was able to accommodate our party of 14. We were about 20 minutes late (running on Chinese time) but we did not get any type of attitude thrown at us at all. We had plenty of wine from 8:30 PM  - closing time and our bill came out more than reasonable. I can't say that I am a wine snob but I have had quite a bit of wine in my time and I really enjoyed the wine selection that we had. My favorite of the night happened to be the very first 1/2 bottle of sparkling moscato that we had. 

Since we've ventured into our 26th year of classiness, I'm sure Mr.. Dubs and I will be back for date night. 

Stay classy, San Francisco!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
When you have old grumpy regulars who don't like you sitting in their favorite spots it might be time to try to cultivate some new folks. The fiancé and I were sitting at a near empty bar until -we'll just call her Mrs Kravitz- arrived and stared me down because I had absentmindedly placed my backpack on the stool next to me. Did I mention it was nearly empty? I took the bag, gave the apology face and placed it on the floor. And then Mrs Kravitz proceeded to put her purse on that same stool! WTF! You'll also see the antisocial wine drinkers nose deep in their laptops giving you stink eye as you figure out where to sit. 
Here's a tip for the owner: if a customer is having difficulty deciding what varietal to choose you might want to find out their palate and even offer a tiny taste. Just saying...
author: Meredith G.

description:
I had a meh experience.  so so service... so so wine... meh

They need to try harder and maybe I'll give another chance
author: Jim S.

description:
Great owners, great international selection of wines, tasty charcuterie + cheese options, cozy, nice neighborhood.  Can't say enough great things about Que Syrah.  After staring at it a couple of times on my muni ride through West Portal, I decided to give it a try.  We've been a few times since because it is just a great place to be when you want to relax and have great conversation. 

It's a tiny space, but therein lies its charm.  It's nice to have a neighborhood establishment like Que Syrah.
author: Ghizal A.

description: Neighborhood wine bar owned by a couple who are clearly legit wine enthusiasts, knowing not just the wine but often the people who made it.  I had the Syrah flight and my companion had a glass of Chardonnay (plus 2 apps:  the cheese plate and some fig jam crisps).  Good for a pre or post dinner drink but not the kind of place you can settle into for the long haul bc the food selection seemed more for an accompanient.
author: Leigh F.

description: Small intimate place, had a cozy romantic feel to it. Husband had a featured flight of Cabernet, I had a rhone blend. We both enjoyed our picks. We didn't try anything off the menu but prices seemed reasonable. I'd recommend for a pre-dinner drink or a nice glass after work.
author: Lori C.

description:
Very cute spot for a glass of wine, some fantastic Italian cheeses and a delicious hard cheese from Utah - sea hive. Mmmm. We had the sparkling wine flight and my favorite was the cremant rose. Great concept. Also looked like they sold bottles too. 
Nice ambiance with the fireplace and small tables. 
Great job!
author: Christine V.

description:
Phenomenal wine selections they have here. I went here after having Peruvian food for brunch with my bro. I felt like I need some good wine into my system. 

The lady that only works there is super. I am very satisfied with her outstanding service! 

We had a few dessert wines, Pinot noir, appetizers consist of bread, cheese, and cured meat! I feel that the appetizers need work. Other than that, everything is awesome. The place has a real nice vibe as you sip up that red elixir drink on a nice crystal clear wine glass...
author: Jan P.

description: Great small wine bar with friendly owners and a selection of wines that you don't find everywhere else. Cheese plates too!
author: Amy H.

description: What a nice little spot. Great date night location... Fine wine and good conversation is a win win. The decor is cozy, dimly lit with a cute electric fireplace. I would definitely come back. They have a fine selection of cheeses to go with your wine. The owners of this establishment are friendly and welcoming plus very knowledgeable regarding their products. I recommend trying their weekly flights.
author: Mary H.

description: This neighborhood wine bar has SF charm written all over it.  The owners are constantly sourcing new wines to cycle onto their wine list so it's great coming in and trying a new bottle.  The pourers are very friendly and knowledgable about the wines they have on the menu.  Lovely place to stop by if you're looking for a mellow night out!
author: Jojo L.

description:
One of the best wine bars I've been to!  Great atmosphere and the wines are always delicious!

The service is always fast and friendly.
author: Aaron P.

description:
I went to Que Syrah a few years ago after reading all the positive yelp reviews. It didn't make an impression--maybe because I went in broad daylight, or more likely because of the company. I was surprised, then, at how much I loved it when I returned three years later (in the evening, in better company). 

Que Syrah has an extensive wine selection and the ambiance is warm and cozy. What really made our experience, however, was the owner (?)/ sommelier. I had asked a question about a wine I decided not to try, and when he brought over the glass I did order, he also brought along a taste of the wine I inquired about. He then brought us two more complimentary tastes, saying that because they were closed the following day, we might as well finish some of the inventory. 

This will be the new stop after pizza at Paradise Pizza and Pasta. My mom likes to say that nothing goes well with pizza like milk (seriously). I'm not sure that will really catch on, but following pizza with wine is never a bad idea.
author: Susan S.

description:
Such a cute place in a cute neighborhood.

We stopped in for a quick glass of wine while walking through this part of town.  We were greeted quickly by the friendly people there and the wine was fantastic!

We will definitely be back.
author: Cass H.

description:
I know this will shock those of you who know me but wine bars are not my area of expertise. I cant go long on the wine lists, ideal pairings, legs - noses - shoulders and other anatomical parts of wine criticism. 

What i can comment on is the solid customer service. I was in a party of 4 that grew to 6, we were there for a friends birthday, and the owner/host made sure that the birthday boy's glass was never empty, as well as kept suggestions coming. The host also kept the atmosphere fun and informal which is cool considering that wine bars can be perceived as boring and stodgy.

I dont recall the exact wine i had - it was a suggestion and it was definitely better tasting and more interesting than 2 buck chuck :)

A really big positive that i thought is worth a mention is that they have 2 varieties of Poulaner - i think thats great in case you end up here with non wine drinkers or just dont feel like wine anymore

Finally this is not a huge space which works well for the type of establishment that this is. With music playing and conversations going - i could still hear everyone at the table very comfortably which a huge plus.  And a final word about customer service - i think we stayed about 45 mins passed closing time and the service remained great throughout, which gets the establishment a star.
author: Oleg H.

description: Great wine selection and very friendly service. I always have a nice and mellow time when I come here :)
author: Lia B.

description:
I have a friend, who raves a lot (too much) when she 'discovers' some low-key, hidden gem - with respect to food and booze, especially booze.  She's very pushy, highly recommending (forcing me to visit) this comfy and intimate wine bar with a relatively nondescript façade; I told her, "whatever will be will be."  Thus, I found myself at 'Que Syrah'.

My friends and I walked in after a large dinner, at around 6ish, and were immediately relaxed (the itis/food coma played a factor) by the soothing lighting and intimate, comfortable atmosphere.  We came on a great night; or what would have been a great night if we hadn't stuffed our faces earlier. 

It was tapas night.  There was an incredibly large menu of tapas, including 'lechón kawali', which I believe is (or should be) Tagalog for amazing.  It had all the mouthwatering elements of crunchy, tender, savory, and pork-y.  This tapas menu offered the wonderful creations of a local caterer.  I think his name was Val.  We even tried his exceptionally roasted, sweet and slightly spicy Marcona Almonds, that paired well with my glass of  'Hocus Pocus Syrah'.

The extra-generous pour into our full-bodied adventure at 'Que Syrah' was the extremely helpful and welcoming staff - they were attentive and helpful without being pushy and condescending.  I am quite an amateur when it comes to drinking wine - much less at a niche wine bar - and their consideration, and wonderful tapas, supplied me and my friends with an experience worthy of five stars.

I will say thought that because it's a small space, seating is limited.  I, however, like to stand; I believe it to be a more engaging experience that way.  I know that most would disagree.  Oh well, like they say (or should say), "Que syrah, syrah."

Positives:
- Friendly, Intimate and Comfortable Atmosphere
- Helpful and Attentive Staff
- Friendly Customers
- Delicious Tapas
- Great Wine
- Generous Pouring

Negatives:
- Prices Steeply Escalate with each Glass & Tapas
- Limited Seating
author: Phillip W.

description:
I'm always looking for a good glass of vino for cheap and this is the place.

***********JACKPOT**********

and it's good wine - not the bottom shelf of safeway wine like you see in some wine bars? I mean - we are in San Francisco, the mecca of wine, the gateway to the wine country and some places have the nerve to call themselves a wine bar serving Barefoot, Turning Leaf, and Yellow Tail.
author: Rew C.

description:
Stephanie and Keith are phenomenal at picking good wine.  I like that they are from small production wineries, so you get to try things you wouldn't ordinarily get to.

I have also had several small parties there and they are quite reasonable.  Chef Val can make his tapas menu available, or you can organize your own.  My guests have always commented on how quaint and comfortable it is and usually walk out with a bottle or two.

West Portal is a vibrant street and Que Syrah makes it even more so.

I can't recommend them highly enough.
author: Eric C.

description:
Okay, I can't truly comment too detailed on this place because honestly, I drank about 6 glasses of delicious wine and don't remember too much after that.

So I came with some co-workers from work and we had a great time. They served us really good hors d'oeurves (the salmon was just divine!) and had wines pouring out the bottles.

This is a rather small wine bar so it's quite intimate. There's a small fake fireplace that while cheesy makes for a nice part of the ambiance.

I honestly don't remember the wines that I drank. I remember most of the wines seemed to be from the central valley but many also from Sonoma. 

The owners were really nice and very interested in talking to us about their business and what they knew about wines. 

Only two things I didn't quite like about this place (and they're really minor):
1. I don't live close by at all - no fault of the establishment
2. You can't bring a baby here - now this is somewhat of a blurry area for me. While I understand that a wine bar cannot have babies or anyone under 21, I was under the impression that any place that had food, you COULD have babies. I've been to multiple wine bars that people were able to bring their babies or kids. I was at a private party and two people I knew were not allowed to bring their baby, so I am sure that the baby factor wasn't because it would disturb other customers.

Anyways, if you live in the neighborhood and you like wine, this is not a bad place to spend time with a few close friends. The parking isn't hard to find either.
author: Julia P.

description: Great wine selection, I like that they had excellent service too. It has a very warm and comfy atmosphere. Veggie empanadas and chocolate truffles were top notch & charcuterie had a very flavorful pate.
author: Ramon B.

description: A hidden gem that is easy to miss if not intentionally looking for it. Great ambiance and wine selection. Highly recommend!
author: Sandy Y.

description: Quiet little wine bar. Went here with some close friends to hide from the rain. Sampled some nice reds and the bartender recommended some cheese pairings that tickled the palettes quite nicely. Very intimate setting with dim lighting. Not so much a place to take a date out to but more of a good place to catch up on some conversations with a long lost friend.
author: Jerry Y.

description: Great service! Great neighborhood wine bar tucked away in west portal.  Ambiance is great, feels like you are enjoying a glass of wine at a friends house.  They always have a great wine flight tasting and the wines on the menu change often.  Also don't miss out on the cheeses, great selections!
author: Andrew A.

description: The wines here are delicious and so is the pairing of cheese, fruit and other tasty food items to go with the wine. Que Syrah is a very down to earth place and also very inviting. A nice place to enjoy a fine glass of wine with friends.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
It has been a neighborhood bar past few days. I love West Portal and welcome a place close to the abode to socialize. I like wine so why not check it out.

I must say it is nice little gem. Run by a husband and wife. I like a friendly and attentive staff. I like the warm decor and the presentation of the various wines. I will be back to sample more some other time.
author: Infodiva B.

description: Cute little wine bar in West Portal. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It's a very small place but we were able to nag the 4 top table right in the front. It was a Sat night, so I'm not sure if it gets very busy or not.  The chocolate truffles were amazing and a great compliment to the wine. We tried a bottle of the Rose, and I wish I remembered which the name of the wine to recommend on here. Very low key, chill place to have a nice glass of wine with a friend, loved one, or awkward first date.
author: Rosie G.

description: charming inside, great wines, the owners are lovely.  I joined the wine club and all of the bottles have been home runs!
author: Amy Nicole W.

description:
My friend introduced me to this place and we spent many a Friday after work drinks here. It's small and quiet which I like. It's owned by a very nice and knowledgable couple. They always have a wine flight and then other wines and small plates like cheese, olives, etc. 
We usually request the person serving us to choose a cheese tray to accompany our wine. 
One of my faves in West Portal
author: Dbs B.

description:
Ohhh... Hello? Que Syrah

My favorite paring is usually a hole in the wall and a wine bar. Que Syrah fits the mold. You might overlook this hidden gem amid the many little shops and restaurants along West Portal. They have a small bar area in the back and a limited number of tables.

So, I'm telling you... don't miss this spot!!

I love the intimacy, the cheese, the wine! The weekly wine flights keeps your thirst quenched and yet still curious. I sure wanted to return after having a peppery Pinot as part of a tasting. 

The cheese selection is superb as well. I found my recent favorites here, the Midnight Moon & Tasmanian Heritage Red Square. I start a vicious cycle when I nibble and sip, sip and nibble.

Where else can you find a spot like this around the Sunset? You can enjoy your wine in the comfort of your home but you may also have a great night out at Que Syrah.
author: Sam T.

description:
Que Syrah is the perfect neighborhood wine bar. They offer a variety of good wines from small producers, along with cheese, desserts, etc. It's a comfortable place-- usually quiet enough to carry on a conversation with friends-- and the prices are reasonable. 

Most importantly, while they will suggest wines to try, nobody will treat you like an idiot for preferring something different. 

Because many of the wines are from small producers, you might not be familiar with the names, and you might not find them at the supermarket. Fortunately, they sell most of the wines by the bottle.
author: Bruce S.

description: I prefer this place than Vin debut. Place is not pretentious. Its small,cozy, warm and romantic. Perfect place for you and your hunnie to get away. Gets pretty crowded even on a week night so get here early.  Love their HUGE wine selection.  Will defintiely come back and try some food with wine.
author: Claudine V.

description:
Simple, elegant, tiny, clean, smiling and helpful help, intriguing wine choices, tasty bits of food - what's not to like?

Bottle prices are fair, and the span of bottle offerings runs far wider and more creatively than those standard, high-thud-factor, predictable, leather-bound wine lists.  Plenty of Syrah (as you might expect), Petite Sirah, Zin, even a Pinotage, Viognier, Italian and Italian-style whites; wines of many types from all over the world, though with a Cali leaning.  I had 3-glass Zin tasting flight, all Sonoma Zins, one Dry Creek Valley, two Sonoma Valleys, and all utterly different - exhibiting the range of the varietal.  A thoughtful, gentle, relaxing atmosphere.

Lovely.
author: Evan Q.

description: Noeteca in Noe Valley is still my favorite wine bar.  This is isn't too bad though.  What really sets this place apart from regular wine bars is the excellent service.  The staff really know their wine and can tell you a lot about them.  However I do wish they had more snack items like Noeteca.
author: Tiffany C.

description: I had a glass of cava during happy hour, So it was a dollar off. It's a very simple and comfortable environment, with clusters of tables that fit 2-4 people, two couches near a fireplace that would fit four or five, and a bar area. It was pretty quiet, a little too quiet if you ask me. Some background music would have been great!  Overall an ideal place to catch up with a friend, go on a date, or have a peaceful glass of wine to yourself. Super friendly and chill service, I did not feel pressured to order right away or refill my glass!
author: Kassaundra G.

description:
Que Syrah Wine Bar is very lovely and delightful in their wine offerings and small bites, ambiance and super nice staff. Very worthy of 4 stars! 

The husband and wife owners are quite a dynamic duo; so friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. The space is narrow long, but it works as it offers two - four tops, lounge seating (see couch and coffee table setting), and the bar. Bright and cozy, it's also very classic and quaint. 

The wine offerings have been by and large very desirable. Plenty to choose from with fun flights at a decent price. Their cheese selection is superb, as are their chorizo and olives. Never been on the nights where tapas are served, but after reading all the other Yelp reviews, I may have to make it a point to go. 

During my last visit, my companion and I participated in their International Wine Tasting event for $15. The tasting included wines from Greece, France, Chile and a few others with two whites and three or four reds. With the exception of a couple of them my companion and I thoroughly enjoyed them. Nice that the wine distributor gave us a brief background on each wine including the region of the vineyard, types of grapes and vineyard owners and noteworthy wine making processes. The event also included a nice selection of cheese and bread. Great event! 

Will continue going to Que Syrah...and likely to try their tapas!!
author: Marie B.

description: Great wines. Good little finger food. Small yet quaint - nice owners. Overall a relaxing atmosphere to have an intimate conversation - I had a memorable experience.
author: S. M.

description:
As a wine guy, I appreciate a place like Que Syrah.  Que Syrah is a small and intimate space.  An ideal place to go for a wonderful glass of wine and conversation.  A rare space where you can actually here your friend, date or family member without a double take on asking "what" or a shouting conversation.

A small but nicely edited selection of wines by the glass, a bit larger on wines by the bottle.  Perfect place for intimate gatherings and a nice way to start off or end an evening.  Perfectly nice staff!  I look forward to a re-visit.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
Nice ambiance, great place to go if your in the mood for a stress reliever. The woman and her hubby who own the place are one of the nicest people I've met. 

If you want some time for yourself or engage in conversation this spot is ideal.  Theres a cozy vibe and nothing like a good selection of reds and whites, you'll probably be staying for more than one glass.
author: Jade D.

description: Awesome place! Come Thursdays for tapas  and wine. Great service and food/drinks. Will be back.
author: David S.

description:
Saturday night, my friend and I stopped by this place. It's a neighborhood wine bar in West Portal. Cute and cozy place! Ambiance is nice - a lot of couples. I think it'd be a nice date place.

The service was really good. I'm not a wine expert... Was a little lost when I read the menu. However, there was the tasting menu which was a Cabernet Sauvignon flight - 3 wines from S. Africa, Sonoma, and  El Dorado. Made my decision easy! For $12 to taste 3 wines, not bad. And they were generous in pouring too!

They have a happy hour special on Tuesdays between 4 and 8pm. I believe it's a $1 off a glass. If you're interested, give them a call for specifics.
author: Lynn F.

description:
A friend suggested we head to a wine bar in West Portal.  Although I found the name, "Que Syrah" catchy, I was filled with the usual dread at the thought of entering yet another pretentious wine bar where if you don't know what you want, and more importantly can't sum up your first mouthful with at least 7 obscure adjectives, you will feel hopelessly out of place.

Thankfully this intimate wine bar tucked away beside a hair boutique and jewelers in West Portal eroded past experiences and shattered stereotypes.

The guy who served us was relaxed, unpushy and informed us of the wine flight of the week (three Grenache servings for $11).  He gave us time and we felt unrushed in our choice making.  I get easily baffled by all the intriguing names and grape classifications, a lack of confidence from lack of knowledge.  On ordering I tried to give a rough indication of what I liked using very boring words like "red" and "heavy". The guy was very helpful, made some suggestions and voila!... I had ordered and not felt at all like a loser! My friend had the Gregory Graham 2006 Grenache, Red Hills, Crimson Hill Vine Yard, Lake County ($11) and I tried the Genuine Risk, 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon, Santa Ynez Valley ($11.5) Wow! I was so blown away with it, we ordered the 3 Cheeses with Chorizo ($15).  Again the guy suggested which cheeses would best accompany the wine and we went with:  Seal Bay, Tasmanian Red Square (both Australian, cows milk) and Zamorano (Spanish, sheep's milk).  They were served with ample bread, chorizo & salami and garnished with dried blueberries and apricots. All were delicious but the really rich buttery-ness and hint of nut in the Seal Bay did it for me!

We opted for another glass and reached out to try something different, choosing Graff Family 2006 "Consensus" Syrah Chalone ($9) and Gregory Graham 2006 Zinfandel, Red Hills, Crimson Hill Vine Yard, Lake County ($11) Our "consensus" was definitely the most intensive of all the wines, and my favorite of the evening was my original choice Genuine Risk, which had turned out to be a genuine gem.

We indulged with some Chocolate Truffles: raspberry, hazelnut, earl grey, dark chocolate.  Surprisingly for me, the Earl Grey shone through.

There's a refreshing ambience to this place. A mellow mixture of World Electronic and Latin Salsa played whilst we sipped on the pressed grapes, quiet enough to carry on a conversation but not low enough to be insipid and irrelevant. The wooden floors and lack of clutter gave it a clean, freshness while the wall tea lights and limited roof spotlights maintained the intimacy.

The mirrors of varying sizes help elongate the space consisting of two comfy sofas (ideal for a group), four tables each with three chairs.  At the bar there are a further eight seats where you can chat away to the owners. Their service was ideal: not someone in your face every five minutes, but a raise of your eyes and someone is coming to your table instantly.  Prices were reasonable and the staff ready to share their expertise in a friendly, non-superior manner.

Whether you have a small or vast understanding of wines, if you are ever in the West Portal area, please stop by Que Syrah.

What will be, will be and you will not be disappointed.
author: Angela D.

description:
Went there last Thursday w/ my girlfriends and could not believe that they Lechon on the tapas' menu- a Philippines style roast pork with crunchy skin. It was only for $5 and by far the best Lechon I had ever ever had! Raise a glass to VAL - the master chef! And their wine selection is not too shabby! Would I go back? Hell yes! 
The atmosphere is nice and relaxing... get there early if you want to sit down.
author: Annie T.

description: Que Syrah is a great place to go for an overall wine experience in the city.  My Wife & I stumbled upon the place one Saturday evening some months back, and it happened to be paella night.  It was being prepared such that the aroma was hard to resist.  We ventured in as they were pairing some great wines that night, and we ended up taking 2 bottles home that were wonderful to share with our friends.  Keith & Stephanie are terrific folks, and are more than accommodating.  We just went again Saturday for a fall Paella & wine pairing that was out of this world.  Que Syrah is a great find, and we already look forward to going back again soon!  =)
author: Sean B.

description: I love West Portal area. I'm glad to found this wine bar. Small place but very nice and quiet. I was having Tamarack 2009 Cabernet and olives enjoy by myself yesterday. Definitely will come back, I'm gonna to try the Pinot and cheese next time :) I love food, I love wine, I love enjoy my life ! :)
author: DontHurtMe T.

description: A good friend took me here. The plus is it's in West Portal. Wine and olives is good. I'll be back.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Stop and drop in at Que Syrah in West Portal especially on Thursdays when they are serving Tapas.  This little wine bar has it all--weekly wine flights, nice cozy atmosphere, good wine,  tasty small plates  and excellent service. The Owners and Staff are friendly and down to earth, a rare find in wine bars these days.   

What a great way to wind down the week with a delicious glass (or two!!) of wine and a delicous selection of tapas to choose from.  Do try  a plate (or two) of lechon.  Oh, yes, tender pieces of pork with crunchy pieces of skin, yummo!  

Give Que Syrah a try, you won't be disappointed!
author: T T.

description: Lovely neighborhood spot on West Portal. Nice wines, cheese and knowledgable and friendly staff.
author: Liz W.

description:
We actually had dinner here.  My wife and I each ordered the current wine flight, and we also ordered the charcuterie plate, a selection of three cheeses and the blue cheeses with walnut honey.  All of the food was yummy, it was great to get to nibble on a bunch of different items as we enjoyed our wine, and we ended up plenty satisfied.

We ended up having a very nice, relaxing dinner out for less than it would have cost us to have a meal with wine at most restaurants.

It was nice to talk to the owners and learn a little more about the food and wine we were enjoying as well.  Talking about food and wine always makes having food and wine even more enjoyable.
author: Greg H.

description: Que Syrah is a great place to go when you want a cool mellow atmosphere to have a nice glass of great wine.  Kieth and Stephanie really go out of their way to find unique wines to offer as well as having Tapas Night.  Fun just to have a seat at the bar and have a glass or gather your friends around a table and share a bottle or two.  Lovely place to chill out after a hectic day
author: Mark N.

description: I like this little wine bar tucked away here. It's a small cozy place and the owner spent a lot of time explaining things to us.
author: Tiff W.

description:
I had worked a grueling 12-hour day for the 3rd day in a row.  Overtime was wearing on me.  I got home to my beloved and the only thing I wanted was a really nice bottle of red wine, over-sized glasses, and a dark, mellow room --and maybe a cheese plate.

I live in the O.M.I.  We don't exactly have wine bars in my hood.  So I suggested, "that cute little place in West Portal," Que Syrah, which was the closest wine bar I could think of.

We found immediate parking and a locked door in front of a bar full of people.  The sign on the door said, "CLOSED".  The posted hours were closed at 10:30 and last call was 10pm.  It was 9:45.  WTF?

 I could probably give them some slack for closing early if they were slow, but the place was packed.  I knocked on the door and was blatantly ignored.

It must be good to have so much business that you don't need to take people's money.  Or maybe it was just a couple snot-nosed college kids running the place who wanted to go home early.  Whatever the reason, next time, I'll take my business downtown --where they stay open until reasonable hours and understand that they have competition.
author: Amy A.

description:
Arguably one of the best places in the city to get a glass (or three, or a bottle) of wine.  Here's why:

1) Atmosphere.  Small, neighborhoody place.  It's a no-frills wine bar, meaning that it is not at all pretentious.  You can choose to sit at the bar (my preference), a table, or the couch and coffee table.  Also, they have some good jazz playing.  Kind of like being in a buddy's living room.

2) The service.  The owners (Keith and Stephanie) know their wine.  What's more, they taste every bottle that they open to insure quality.  And it doesn't hurt matters that they are very friendly.

3) The wine.  Let's get down to brass tacks - it's all about the product.  The specialty here is small, passionate producers of quality wine.  It is not uncommon to see a winemaker come in to have them taste some wines for possible inclusion on the list.  The selection is ample and well-balanced, with a weekly flight offering.  And if you have a glass of something you really like, you can buy a bottle to take home at the retail price.

Great place to get a pre/post-dinner/movie glass.  And they are the only wine bar that I'm aware of that opens before 5pm (3pm here), which has caused me to leave work early a couple of times.
author: mcmalaprop ..

description:
Blink and you could miss this new wine bar in the formerly sleepy neighborhood of West Portal.  I live 5 minutes from there, and had no idea it existed until I read about it on Yelp (hi, Suzanne B.!)

I was there during an odd hour - 6pm on a Sunday evening.  So we were the only patrons in the place which makes it hard to judge the vibe. The coffee table and microsuede couches, low lighting, jazz in the background made for a cozy, if somewhat sterile, atmosphere - a bit like dining in a Pottery Barn display (take that as you wish).  There are various tables and a bar for other seating options.

It's a little puzzling to decide what to have, as there is not a huge selection of wine by the glass, and I was unfamiliar with most of them.  My brother and his girlfriend ordered a Malbec, which I have to admit was not my favorite (and I adore Malbecs).  I ordered the featured Italian wine flight which was quite good.

We had a the cheese plate, which featured a Petit Basque, a Spanish cheese with a paprika rind, and a third cheese which I have forgotten by now.  Portions were ample, but I would not say generous.

My experience was nice, but I can't say that it stood out as extraordinary.  However, I am so pleased to have a wine bar in my neighborhood that I will definitely go back.  Service was friendly and the prices were reasonable - also pluses.

My next venture will be to check out Happy Hour Tuesdays (4pm-8pm), with $1 off of wines by the glass.   Stay tuned.
author: Liz S.

description:
Small, comfortable - Que Syrah was exactly what we needed last night after a feast of goodies at a local restaurant.

I'll admit first off - I was put off by the wine list.  Not by what was offered in terms of wine (which was excellent!), but by the fact that only about half of the listed wines were offered by the glass.   I tend to prefer lists with more extensive glass offerings.

The service, however, was impeccable.  I am assuming the gentleman who helped our group is one of the owners - owner or not, he knew his stuff.  He helped each of us select just the right wine for our mood and current taste - and let me tell you, that is a talent, people.  Not everyone can listen to you (especially me since I was half falling asleep from tiredness and too much food and was vaguely incoherent) and determine the keys to your personal taste.  Each of us ended up with a different wine and each was perfectly happy with the choice.

I also liked the atmosphere - though the tall  white walls struck me as a bit too sterile and generic for the rest of the look.  Comfy couches, small round tables, lights around the window, the narrowness of the space - all contribute to a comfortable vibe that invites you to relax and enjoy.
author: Suzanne B.

description: Stephanie and Keith are nicest people you'll ever meet and they are very wonderful hosts at Que Syrah.  I've been here at least four or five times and each visit is a treat.
author: Walter P.

description: So comfortable. Like an extension of our living room, only with much better wine :-). A true neighborhood gem.
author: V. L.

description: Great little wine bar in West Portal. They have a great varied selection of wines that is always changing. They also have some yummy small plates. On some nights they have also started doing tapas. Qur Syrah is owned by a husband and wife team that make the place really cozy. One of the best wine bars in the city. And since it's West Portal, parking at night is usually pretty easy.
author: Rebecca D.

description: My husband and Iove coming here for date night.  Great place to have a conversation where we can hear eachother. Great selection of wine. Like the Tapas they had on Thursdays.   In our hood so driving is quick and parking is usually right out front.  It does get crowded on Thursdays and Friday but we have rarely had to go somewhere else.
author: Tina S.

description:
Nice accoutrements, atmosphere and food.  Wine choices were all well above average.  Service was prompt without being overbearing.  

My wife and I needed a little getaway from the routine and Que Syrah provided a perfect experience.  Just what the doctor ordered.

My only qualm:  We were the only people in there on a Sunday afternoon.  Please go give them your business.  You won't be disappointed in the experience.
author: John R.

description:
I am giving Que Syrah 5 stars because as far as wine bars go, this has got to be the best wine bar in San Francisco.  I am not a wine expert, and so it is nice to know that when I go to Que Syrah the folks working there will make recommendations about what wines you should taste, without making you feel like a moron (something I cannot say about other wine bars).  
I have hosted both a birthday party and a wedding shower at Que Syrah, and the owners (Stephanie and Keith) made both events an awesome experience.  I will definitely hold many events there, that is for sure.
If you are looking to learn about wine, or are already a wine lover, then I highly recommend you check out Que Syrah!!!!
author: Mariana A.

description:
Stop #2 on the West Portal pub tour...

Ok, obviously this is not a pub.  But a wine bar seems like just the thing West Portal needs.  If only it was right next to Roti, you'd have some major synergy going on.  

I must have walked by here 10 times without noticing it, and in fact I even walked by when I was looking for it.  It's a tiny little nook of a place, with a little bar, a few tables, and a pair of couches with a coffee table.  At 10:00 on a Saturday there was only one other group here, so my guess is it's more of an 8:00 scene.  It's too bad, because I think the experience would have benefited from a little more hustle and bustle.

As the other reviewers note, they don't have very many wines by the glass, so I just went with the wine flight, which at $12 is a pretty good deal--you get at least 1.5 to 2 glasses worth.  They had a Zin from Amador, a blend from Lodi, and a Petite Syrah from Santa Cruz (my pick of the bunch).  Truthfully, I was kind of caught up in conversation the whole time so I didn't spend too much time judging the wines, but they were definitely solid.

Overall, the atmosphere leans towards the romantic, so this would be a great place to bring a date after dinner, or also to hobnob with a mixed company of oenophile friends.  If you're looking for more of a refined, leather-chair and scotch place to wax philosophical with your man-friends, though, Que Syrah is probably not what you want.
author: Wes M.

description: Small, friendly wine bar owned and operated by Keith and Stephanie, with a great selection of wines and cheeses.
author: Chuck V.

description:
West Portal - 'I don't live near there, I never go there' is what I usually get from some stubborn 'Castro/Mission/Noe/Russian Hill' based San Francisco friends.  

I'm lucky enough to live near West Portal, and when I force them to come to me I choose this place. They are impressed by this little hide-away nook.  Perfect for wine/conversation and cheese.  The owners are knowledgeable and friendly and attentive of your empty glass!  

They close a little early (10pm) but I guess you got to kick you out sometime.  Neighborhoods are meant to be shared and visited, and this place is a reason to do both.
author: Ryan C.

description:
First came here for Yelp drinks week a few weeks back when they had select glasses of wine for $4. This place is VERY small, and if you weren't looking for it, it can easily be missed. But I found it to be a very nice, relaxing spot to chill and have a glass or two of wine. 

On Fridays, they also serve tapas and their cheese platter was very good as well. My friends and I have been here a couple of times since already.
author: Joel J.

description:
One of the regular patrons at Chouchou restaurant recommended this wine bar...the first of its kind in the neighborhood. Sunset and it's surrounding areas are sleepy compared to the rest of the city, so we were excited to learn about a wine bar opening up minutes from home. 

It's a sliver of a place, easily missed if it weren't for the big sign hanging out on the sidewalk. Nice atmosphere inside with comfortable seating and bar area. The focus is definitely on small producers of quality wine, because we hadn't heard of many of the wineries listed in the menu. We were very happy with our selections and the owner was very friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Virg Y.

description: Tiny wine bar located in West Portal Area.  It is close enough because I live in Daly City.  Wine selection is very good.  What impressed me was the desert wine sampler.  The lady there recommended a sampler with 3 different desert wine pairing with 3 different chocolate truffles.  The 3 wines are muscat, tokay and port.  The tokay is the special superstar.  Try it.  It is great.
author: William F.

description:
This place has a wonderful ambiance as well as good service. It's a small dark room lit mainly by the candles on the tables. 

The employees are very knowledgeable about wine. They will find you something you will enjoy. 

My only complaint is its a bit too cozy, if you go with a group of more than 4, you get squished. The do have a few beer choices so bring along your friend who doesn't like wine.

A great place to take a date for an intimate time. You will see many other couples there. It really has a Parisian feel to it.

I'm not much of a Wine expert, but I had a good time. I started with the "flight" which is a sampler and then i picked something i liked from the sample.
author: Jaqk T.

description: Que Syrah Tapas + Que Syrah Wine = a perfect thursday night!
author: james s.

description: Cute, little wine bar.  Great find in west portal.
author: Amanda P.

description:
This great little place is a 5-starer in itself, but the 'regulars' who hang out there are pretty lame, and very loud about thier right wing political views, and if I have to listen to that while I enjoy a good glass of wine, no matter how delicious and moderately priced, it becomes a 4 star experience.
But stop by this place on a night the regulars AREN'T there and you're in for a treat.  Really exceptional and friendly servers, a wide variety of yummy wines, a weekly featured flight for tasting, great small plates, and a darling intimate (albeit very small) space to enjoy it all in.
author: Jeanine J.

description:
Decided to give this place another try last month before dinner at Old Krakow.

The place does not have much ambiance.  It kind of reminded me of a suburban basement and it is awkwardly laid out.  They did not have much of a crowd.  It was the Sunday of Labor Day Weekend.  

The wine list was good but nothing to really write home about.  I did much enjoy the Lioco Carignane I had though.  I would've had a second glass but we needed a snack. And, they were out of the almonds we wanted.  She said that they did not come with their shipment on Wednesday.  Damn, its Sunday!  Go to Whole Foods and buy some damn almonds.  Had they, they not only would have sold us an order they also would've sold two more glasses of wine.
author: Jeff P.

description: A great new wine bar in an underserved and under-rated neighborhood.
author: H. Joseph E.

description: I love this place!  They always recommend the best wines and the staff is always friendly and accommodating.  I especially love going here on tapas night.  The tapas they serve are delicious!  This is the perfect place to go if you want to unwind, relax and have a drink.
author: Jenece S.

description: While the wine choices can be a little pricey, this is a lovely addition to West Portal.  It's cozy, classy and the service is excellent!  I only wish they were open past 11 on weekend evenings...
author: Lauren C.

description:
Seeing as eet ees elmost Bastille Day, win wee Fraynglish speeking peo-ple celebrate the Jeu de Paume room, the Fete de la Federation, the Croissant and two "off wiz zee heads," (no headbutts pleez). I thot ees good to go to zee wine bar for zee wine. I try little place in de Oest Por-tal called Que Syrah...Oh nem is soo fun-nee. C'est double entendre. Now you say zees "Peter Piper Picked a peck Of pickled peppers." Ees not so funny as Que Syrah, no?? But Eez o-kay. Not so so goot. Just o-kay. Zee have many choi-zes in Vin. Better if zey 'af more of zee Fraynch Vin. But ...how you say.... no brai-ner. But it is not so much wit de Fraynch Vin. Y-es many Californiee Vin, but not so much Fraynch. Chocolate Truffle avec Vin does not taste so good, silly Vin Bar pe-ople. Strenge flafors of truffle. Blech. Merde. Bet zis ees small, quiet place for zee wine and to make the sex-hay talk with your ..how you say? fromage date. Bon chance with sex-hay. M. Metro sez,  "Liberte', Egalite', Fraternite'.... Bonne Fete Nationale!  And ef a Kir Royale."

Trois ducket for zee eety beety wine-bar in fog Port-al.
author: Johnny C.

description:
the perfect neighborhood bar.  cute.  great, friendly, knowledgeable service (unpretentious and friendly).  great cheeses, beer, snacks and desserts too. 

easy parking.

I just love it.... without doubt, Que Syrah is my favorite wine bar in San Francisco.  Near a couple good restaurants and art movie house.

PS = Ask about the special days [once a month?] when dogs are welcome.  Five Woofs!
author: Java Z.

description: Awesome quiet wine bar  w/out the Marina scene and I've consistently found wine that I would pay $40-70 per bottle for $25ish because the owners(Keith/Stef) have taken the time to discover new micro-wineries and also educate my wine tastes to the types that meet my palate pref......a fine best kept secret in West Portal. High five deservingly!!!!
author: michael d.

description: Really cute little wine bar (love the name!) on West Portal. The owner is super-friendly and really into wine. He knows a ton and loves to tell you about his selections. Great place to pop in before dinner or a movie.
author: Michelle B.

description: As newcomers to the neighborhood, we have found this to be the best place to relax before dinner, enjoy some excellent wine at reasonable prices, and meet the neighbors.  Little tastes to see how if you like the wine, and great recommendations.
author: Spike S.

description: Tried this place on a whim one evening when they were doing a tasting. Nice cozy, unpretentious little place to sit and drink some wine and have some good conversation. They also have a great olive plate and a great cheese plate that makes for some good munchies with the wine. Will definitely go back.
author: Maria M.

description: Eh, it's okay but I think the price point is a little high for the meager charcuterie and cheese plates.  Decent selection of wines.  The owners could be friendlier.
author: M H.

description: Unique selection of wine.  Very knowledgeable staff.  Cozy environment for a small group of friends or colleagues.  The cheese platter could be a little more generous and the wait staff could be a little more attentive.
author: Amy M.

description:
Small-ish, but feels open and light.
Clean, simple atmosphere, but not cold and hard.

Nicely selected weekly flights. The wine list isn't that extensive or adventurous, but still has plenty to offer and shows knowledge and care.

Limited snack menu; I enjoyed my cheeses.

Service is good. She remembered me several months later after only a single visit.
author: Nicole A.

description: Cute little wine bar in the West Portal area.  A friend and I went, not knowing what to expect, and we were both pleasantly surprised.  We each had the flight that they were offering, which was very affordable and very good.  Two reds and a white.  Neither of us are big white fans, but enjoyed it.  We also had a cheese plate and some marcona almonds.  They have a great wine list and the atmosphere is cozy and charming.  I would recommend this place if you are looking for a place to have a nice glass of wine and that is quiet enough to have a good conversation.
author: jen n.

description: I was tasked with the wine for a dinner party and came here for some advice. We were having Lamb. She recommended Syrah. On the way to the wine rack, one customer asked, how are you having the lamb? I said, grilled. He said, "ah, that changes everything." He then recommended a Pinot Noir and a blended Syrah.  It turns out he is a chef. It was delicious. I was a big hit at the party. Such magical things happen at Que Syrah.
author: joanna c.

description: I found this small gem in the West Portal neighborhood by chance during a walk, my boyfriend and I came back at night and had a great time. This is a totally down to earth wine bar, cozy, comfy, a great place to sit a have conversation with friends or a date. The day we visited we were interested in the Portuguese wine selection (which we were not familiar with), the owner came over and described the wines (which were true to his description) he was so welcoming, it was a great learning experience  :)
author: maria a.

description: Unpretentious, this wine bar is a great place to go for a couple of drinks and just chill.  On a warm, lethargic Saturday evening, I stumbled upon Que Syrah with a friend and ended up spending over two hours enjoying a cheese plate, flight of wine (three wonderful European blends), and a not too sweet glass of white wine.  Prices were reasonable, the owners friendly and knowledgeable, and there wasn't this feeling of being rushed.  I'd definitely go back, especially since the couches looked very comfortable.
author: A K.

description:
I love Que Syrah.  Stephanie and Keith are always incredibly nice and helpful and it is the only wine bar where I don't feel bad wearing sweats (nice sweats of course).  

The flights are usually a good choice and a pretty good deal and the almonds are yummy too!
author: Katie C.

description:
lots of fun for us. the walnut honey, banana bread & blue cheese + sauternes is a standout.  

the uber-busy owner was not available & we were in the mood to be engaged. maybe it was crcumstantial ,but we plan on returning for sure - so we'll update when we do. see if that is always the case.
author: Lawrence K.

description: I came here when this place had only been opened about 6 months and it is owned by Keith & Stephanie, two really cool people who have turned me into quite a wine snob these days, as well as my friend Kimmers from Burly, Cali.  Onward, they always feature weekly flights like zins, shiraz, merlot's,etc. The hors d' vors trays are stupendous also. They feature cheeses from France, Norway, Denmark, Switzerland, and the US. The duck pate' spread on water crackers, served with seasonal grapes, and finished off with a "Cannahan Family" Shiraz 04',  with only about 160 cases per harvest, will knock your little snooty block off. Pleeze visit this place as the service is pleasant and the atmosphere at night is very dim and relaxing. You'll soon be schooled by an exceptional wine bar in S.F. yet as Keith & Stephanie are on the front lines in Napa weekly to test everything that goes into your snappy little gullet..!!! Corks Off..!
author: Sven S.

description: I absolutely love this new addition to West Portal. This establishment is generally manned by one of the two owners who both know their wine. I have been in here four times so far and have enjoyed every glass. Since none of the restaurants in West Portal have waiting rooms, I anticipate that I will be spending a bit more time ;-) in here and I am lookign forward to every sip!
author: Frankly G.

description: The owners of this friendly place are Keith and Stephanie, and have created the perfect neighborhood place. Not only is it a fun place to visit, they do off-sale and can help you choose wines for parties or dinners you have planned which is really helpful.  A friend had a client appreciation party there, and it was fantastic.  The tasting flights they offer have to be the best deal in the city.  Can't recommend it enough.
author: Maureen H.

description: I literally fell upon Que Syrah last night after work and was pleasantly surprised. The owner was very kind, attentive and really knew her wine. I was interested to learn that Que Syrah had been open for 3 years since I have never heard about it. After spending some time tasting various wines with my best friend and enjoying a cheese plate, I realized that this location could be better served by a little creative marketing and a visual make over. Don't get me wrong, it looks fine, but with very little money, it could look even better. The wine list is so great that I think the "homey" atmosphere could be upgraded to fit the seriousness of the offerings and the service. Such as real tea lights, not the battery operated variety, in addition to live plants over the bar, not the plastic kind.  And their web page could easily be turned into a full functioning web site that would serve this establishment better. Over all I was pleased and will return, I just see untapped potential at Que Syrah and hope that the owners will add some visual style to a space that has so much potential and get some marketing assistance because they have a great opportunity.
author: Michael R.

description: Very classy and unique place to relax and hang out. Yummy tapas.
author: Winnie P.

description: I love sophisticated places that make you feel at home. Friendly staff offer interesting flights, offer guidance, and know when to just let you be. A good place to take colleagues and/or friends. They never rush you. Cheese plates are a treat!
author: Carma Z.

description: this place is a total gem.  fabulous small production wines for very reasonable price. we hosted my husband's 40th birthday party here -- everyone LOVED it.  stephanie (owner) is wonderful and they have some killer wines.
author: peggy l.
